column2: the museum is a bit strict on their rules.  We brought Jimmy John's subs in our backpack and the coat room wouldn't hold it for us (food would go bad
column4: we had to carry the backpack in front rather than on our back.  The umbrella sticking out of the backpack was a no-no for potential knocking over things.  So
column5: we had to check in the umbrella for $1 which wasn't too bad.  To add further to the story
column6: we tried to eat our subs at the downstairs café.  Well
column7: the staff shooed us away from the tables to the benches by the bathrooms.  I guess it wasn't too bad since they could have kicked us outside the museum.  Also
column8: staff was very particular on all the signage such as drinking water in the outside café next to the sculpture garden.
